selected_quotes: In yet another #CRISPR advance this wk, editing out RNA defects (microsatellite expansion diseases)
RNA-targeting Cas9 can eliminate toxic repetitive #RNA in myotonic #dystrophy #CRISPR #Hunting…
Congratulations to Ron Batra and Dave Nelles for their work in Cell
Impressive use of RNA-targeting Cas9 (RCas9) to target microsat. repeat RNAs @DeeNelles @yeo_lab ht…
Génial! Au lieu d'éditer l'ADN, on détruit les ARNs défectueux pathogènes avec un variant de #CRISPR-CAS9 (RCas9)

citation.abstract: The inter- and intra-tumor heterogeneity of breast cancer needs to be adequately captured in pre-clinical models. We have created a large collection of breast cancer patient-derived tumor xenografts (PDTXs), in which the morphological and molecular characteristics of the originating tumor are preserved through passaging in the mouse. An integrated platform combining in vivo maintenance of these PDTXs along with short-term cultures of PDTX-derived tumor cells (PDTCs) was optimized. Remarkably, the intra-tumor genomic clonal architecture present in the originating breast cancers was mostly preserved upon serial passaging in xenografts and in short-term cultured PDTCs. We assessed drug responses in PDTCs on a high-throughput platform and validated several ex vivo responses in vivo. The biobank represents a powerful resource for pre-clinical breast cancer pharmacogenomic studies (http://caldaslab.cruk.cam.ac.uk/bcape), including identification of biomarkers of response or resistance.
citation.title: Elimination of Toxic Microsatellite Repeat Expansion RNA by RNA-Targeting Cas9

news.title: BioCentury  - RNA-targeted Cas9 eliminates MRE disease RNA foci
news.summary: In a paper published in Cell, researchers at the University of California San Diego used RNA-targeting Cas9 (RCas9) to correct genetic mistakes that lead to microsatellite repeat expansion (MRE) diseases in patient-derived cells and cellular models.

news.summary: In a paper published in Cell, researchers at the University of California San Diego used RNA-targeting Cas9 (RCas9) to correct genetic mistakes that lead to microsatellite repeat expansion (MRE) diseases in patient-derived cells and cellular models.

news.title: UCSD team adapts CRISPR to edit RNA, disease therapies eyed

news.title: How Locana is using CRISPR to go after RNA-driven diseases
news.summary: 10:57 AM Sep 14, 2017 Print PDF Two of the outstanding hurdles for CRISPR-based gene editing are the safety concerns of permanently changing the cell’s DNA and the efficacy limitations of relying on natural DNA repair mechanisms to fix the cuts.

facebook.title: Elimination of Toxic Microsatellite Repeat Expansion RNA by RNA-Targeting Cas9
Elimination of Toxic Microsatellite Repeat Expansion RNA by RNA-Targeting Cas9
facebook.summary:
2017年8月10日、Cellオンライン版はカリフォルニア大学サンディエゴ校のグループによる異常なRNAを標的にした遺伝子編集技術Cas9の論文を掲載しました。

「RNAを標的にしたCas9（RCas9）は、RNAの異常な部分の排除を含む病気の顕著な特徴を逆転させる」とあり、RNA異常で起きる筋強直性ジストロフィーやハンチントン病、ALSなどを治療できる可能性があります。

サンディエゴ・ユニオン・トリビューン紙によると、このグループは治療に向けてサンディエゴでLocanaと呼ばれるバイオテック企業を立ち

facebook.title: Elimination of Toxic Microsatellite Repeat Expansion RNA by RNA-Targeting Cas9
